intro: Chassalia longiloba, commonly known as the long-stemmed chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its showy inflorescence consists of small yellow flowers arranged in a disc, surrounded by white ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats.
